strings: <Cap><leader> discovers a new recipe for the alchemy pot!
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3>
<Cap><string_1> <equal> <Cap><string_2> + <Cap><string_3> + <Cap><string_4>
<se_low>*: Gurgh! Room for plenty more! Hic! I'm not done yet!
<se_def>*: You'll catch your death of cold sleeping out here! Why are you wearing such a ridiculous outfit anyway!?
<se_low>*: Oh, are you on your travels as well? Me too. I'm a peddler. Although you probably gathered that.
<se_low>*: I came here to sell a few things, but I keep getting lost! This place is HUGE! It wouldn't be so bad but everywhere I go looks the same!
<se_low>*: Oh, where am I now!? I feel like I've been walking round and round in circles!
<se_def>*: A black dog? Come to think of it, there was a dog in the town courtyard. I wonder if that's the one you're after.
<se_high>*: Myau!
The cat seems very interested in <hero>'s pocket. It keeps licking its lips and looking at Munchie.
<se_high>*: Mur-mur...
<se_def>*: You need to find Marek? If you can't find him in his room, he's probably at the herb garden again.
<se_def>*: He grows herbs in a cave to the northwest, and tending them takes up a lot of his time.
<se_def>*: It must be very tough going all that way in the cold so often.
<se_high>*: Marek? Yes, I know him well. He often gives us herbs to sell in our shop.
<se_high>*: Oh, you want to know where he is? Hmm... Try asking my husband. He may have an idea.
<se_def>*: Have I seen a big black dog? Not that I recall, no.
<se_def>*: There have been a lot of rumours lately about a big pack of wolves on the prowl, though.
<se_def>*: But I suppose if you're looking for a dog, a wolf won't do. Sorry I can't be of more help.
<se_def>*: The herb doctor, Marek, came to live here some years ago now. He's a very skilled man.
<se_def>*: I had the most awful hangover once, but just a few sips of his herb tea had me up on my feet again in no time!
<se_def>*: I was thrilled, because it meant I could drink as much as I wanted! No more head[-]aches! ...But he got very angry when I said that.
<se_high>*: It's very cold around these parts. That's why so many people drink, to try to warm themselves up.
<se_high>*: In an ideal world, I wouldn't start drinking at lunchtime! But what choice do I have!?
<se_low>*: Marek sometimes has the odd drink and a chat with me here. He's always worrying so much about his herbs.
<se_low>*: It must be very difficult trying to grow them in this cold.
<se_low>*: Nook grass is especially difficult, and that's the herb we need the most!
<se_def>*: I came in search of legends about the Godbird, Empyrea.
<se_def>*: But no one I've spoken to so far has even heard of her! I can't believe I came all that way in the snow for nothing!
<se_def>*: I need a drink!
<se_def>*: They don't sell weapons here until nightfall.
<se_def>*: Sounds a bit fishy, eh? I bet it means they have a few ‘special’ weapons under the counter, if you know what I mean!<page>*: I can hardly wait to see what's on offer!
<se_low>*: That man over there seems to have got the wrong idea.
<se_low>*: The armour shop and the weapon shop share these premises, so one's open during the day and one's open at night.<page>*: That's all there is to it! What's fishy about that!?
<se_low>*: Huh? What do you want? I ain't open durin' the day.
<se_low>*: This is my only chance for a bit of shut-eye, so don't wake me up again, okay?
<se_high>*: That man praying over there keeps staring at me with a really intense look on his face.
<se_high>*: Oh, dear Goddess. Have I done something to cause him ill will towards me?
<se_def>*: The Goddess said I should confess everything! It's time to tell that beautiful nun how I feel about her!
<se_high>*: Come to think of it, I haven't seen Marek recently. I do hope he's not come down with something.
<se_high>*: If he's taken to his bed, I suppose I should say, ‘healer, heal thyself!’
<se_low>Mayor: Do I know a man named Marek? Why, yes, of course! He's the herb doctor here, and he lives in a room I rent out to him.
<se_low>Mayor: If you go downstairs in my house and keep taking rights along the underground passage, you come to the corridor that leads to his room.
<se_low>Mayor: I don't know what relation you are to him, but no doubt he'll be very pleased to have <IF_SOLO>a visitor<ELSE_NOT_SOLO>some visitors<ENDIF_SOLO>.
<se_high>*: People are saying that there are wolves on the prowl just outside town lately.
<se_high>*: The wolves around here are really scary. Once they spot their prey, they never let it go. You won't catch me going outside!
<se_low>*: Marek's room is straight along this corridor.
<se_low>*: He turned up here several years ago now, and the Mayor rented one of his rooms out to him.
<se_low>*: I wonder where he lived before he came here. He never talks about it.
<se_def>*: Do I know about a big black dog? As a matter of fact, I do!
<se_def>*: I was in Arcadia once, and the sorcerer, Dominico, had one as a pet.
<se_def>*: Oh dear! It's run away, has it? And you have the job of trying to find it? Well, I can't imagine that will be easy!
<se_def>*: The herb doctor, Marek, is quite a tough one, but he's nothin' compared to that old woman.
<se_def>*: Marta's her name. You know her? She lives all on her own in a mountain hut near the border tunnel.
<se_def>*: I stopped by her place once when I was out in the mountains. Her nook grass tea did me the world o' good.
<se_high>*: Wa-heeee!
<se_high>*: Be really careful not to slip on the ice! It REALLY hurts if you land on your bum!
<se_high>*: Wa-heeee!
<se_high>*: Be really careful not to slip on the ice! It really hurts if you land on your bum!
<se_high>*: Hey, give it a rest! You're too big! You'll break the ice and spoil everyone's fun!
<se_high>*: Wa-heeee!
<se_high>*: Be really careful not to slip on the ice! You'll get soaked all the way through to your knickers if you land on your bum!
<se_high>*: Wa-heeee!
<se_high>*: Be really careful not to slip on the ice! Your moustache might stick to the ice if you fall on your face!
<se_high>*: I made a snowman! It's really cool, isn't it!? Hee hee!
<se_def>*: R-r-r... Tyav tyav!
<se_low>*: Everywhere I go in this town looks the same, so I keep getting lost!
<se_low>*: My feet are killing me! It feels like I've just been going round in circles ever since I got here!
<se_def>*: Av av!
<se_def>*: Have I seen a black dog? Come to think of it, I did see a dog come inside not long ago.
<se_def>*: I can't remember if it was black or not, but it may well have been the dog you're looking for.
<se_high>*: Myau!
The cat seems very interested in <hero>'s pocket. It keeps licking its lips and looking at Munchie.
<se_high>*: Mur-mur-mur-mur...
<se_def>*: You need to find Marek? If you can't find him in his room, he's probably at the herb garden again.
<se_def>*: He grows herbs in a cave to the northwest, and they take up a lot of his time.
<se_def>*: It must be very tough going all that way in the cold so often.
<se_high>*: If it wasn't for Marek, we'd never be able to make a living out of selling herbs in this kind of climate.
<se_high>*: Before he came along, we ran out of stock more times than I can remember. We're ever so grateful to him.
<se_high>*: Zzzzz...more sliding...tomorrow...zzzz...
<se_high>*: Maybe it's the drink making me hallucinate... I was sure I just saw a dog inside the shop.
<se_high>*: No, I must be seeing things. Urgh, I don't feel at all well...
<se_def>*: Ohhh! Where can I find someone who's heard of the legend of Empyrea!? Somebody around here must know something!
<se_def>*: Um, can I ask you something? Do you know anything about love?
<se_def>*: I'm madly in love with a girl, you see. I can't stop thinking about her.
<se_def>*: The Goddess said I should confess my feelings, but I just can't seem to pluck up enough courage.

<se_def>*: Do I write a love letter? Or do I ask someone else to tell her? Or do I give her a friendly slap on the rump like Igor told me?<page>*: Or do I just stop beating about the bush and tell it to her straight!? It's an absolute minefield!
<se_def>*: Zzzz...phantom weapon...sword of legend...zzzz...
<se_low>*: The nerve of 'im, havin' a snooze in my shop like that!
<se_low>*: Huh! It's really startin' to wind me up now! Maybe it's time to chuck 'im out in the cold!?
<se_low>*: Ah, is it armour you're after? I'm afraid you'll have to come back during the daytime for that.
<se_low>*: There are only weapons on sale here at night.
<se_high>*: I think that man from earlier really hates me, but I've no idea why.

<se_high>*: It's supposed to be my duty to save people by setting a good example which teaches them how to live according to the Goddess.<page>*: But that man is here every day looking right at me, and I don't seem to have taught him anything! I can't be much of a nun, now can I?
<se_high>*: What are you doing wandering about at this late hour? Try not to make too much of a noise, otherwise you'll wake my daughter up.
<se_high>*: Zzzzz...
<se_high>*: I'm exhausted! The master always seems to be giving out orders, even in the middle of the night!
<se_high>*: He never does anything for himself if he can have someone do it for him. And he doesn't seem to get sleepy in the evenings, either!
<se_high>*: I've been on my feet all day long and I'm absolutely exhausted! I wish I could go to bed!
<se_high>*: Zzzz...
<se_high>*: ...Urk! I was almost asleep standing up!
<se_def>*: Aaah, you can't beat lyin' down on the ice with a bellyful of booze!
<se_def>*: Why don't you give it a try? Make sure you don't fall asleep though, eh!?
<se_def>*: Even if you're lucky, you'd end up wiv a cold. And if you ain't lucky, it might just finish you off!
<se_high>*: Marek wasn't in? Oh, I do hate it when he goes off like this. What would happen if I fell ill now, with him away!?
<se_high>*: He's supposed to be the town doctor, so he shouldn't just disappear on a whim!
<se_low>Mayor: Where would Marek be if he's not in his room, you say?
<se_low>Mayor: Hmm... I'm afraid he rather keeps himself to himself. I don't know where he came from or how he lives his life.
<se_low>Mayor: One does wonder where he picked up all that knowledge about herbs. He's a bit of a mystery man, really.
<se_low>*: Looks like you didn't manage to find Marek, then?
<se_low>*: He does sometimes go out of town. Maybe he's not in Orkutsk at the moment.
<se_low>*: I know! You should ask the owner of the item shop. He's quite good friends with Marek, so he might know where he's gone.
<se_low>*: Aaaa<endash> Aaaa<endash> Apchkhi!
<se_low>*: Brrr... I feel sick and my head's spinning. Maybe I'm still drunk!?
<se_def>*: This drunk was getting in people's way, so I moved him here.
<se_def>*: He weighed a ton as well!
<se_low>*: Oh, are you on your travels as well? Me too. I'm a peddler. Although you probably gathered that.
<se_low>*: I came here to sell a few things, but I keep getting lost! This place is HUGE! It wouldn't be so bad but everywhere I go looks the same!
<se_low>*: Oh, where am I now!? I feel like I've been walking round and round in circles!
<se_def>*: Wolves always go round in packs, but the ones we've been seein' here lately have been very strange.
<se_def>*: They all move around together so closely, it's like they're bein' controlled or somethin'.<page>*: I can't explain it, but it's quite eerie to look at.
<se_high>*: My husband's probably the most thankful of all of us that Marek came to live here.
<se_high>*: He's always bringing us herbs to sell in our shop. We really owe him a lot.
<se_def>*: Welcome! What can I get for you? Oh! You're the ones who were looking for that dog, aren't you?
<se_def>*: Someone mentioned that there was a black dog in amongst that pack of wolves that have been on the prowl here lately.
<se_def>*: Apparently, the wolves were treating it as if it was their king or something! Have you ever heard anything so bizarre!?
<se_def>*: HIC! Hold your huskies! Tha's not jus' cold, it's <endash> Hic! <endash> downright <endash> Hic! <endash> FREEZIN'! You leave me no choice! ...I mus' keep on drinking...
<se_low>*: Marek normally has something of a shadow on his face, but today it is all lit up.
<se_low>*: Is it really the nook grass alone that has made him this way? Or is there perhaps some other reason?
<se_def>*: I finally wrote a love letter to my beloved and told her how I feel.
<se_def>*: She's probably reading it right about now... Waah! What do I do!? What do I do!?
<se_def>*: I got it all off my chest, and now my words will be going straight to her heart!<page>*: Oh, the excitement of it all! It's making me feel quite faint!
<se_def>*: I fell asleep last night, but I'm going to make sure I stay up this time.
<se_def>*: Then I'll be able to see what black market weapons they have on sale! I can hardly wait!
<se_low>*: That man over there seems to have got the wrong idea.
<se_low>*: The armour shop and the weapon shop share these premises, so one's open during the day and one's open at night.<page>*: What's all this black market stuff about!?
<se_high>*: Would you mind lending me your ear for a minute? I really need to talk to someone, you see.
<se_high>*: I got a letter from that man that's always staring at me, and now I don't know what to do. Will you look at it for me?
<Cap><leader> takes the letter from the nun.
‘To the overwhelming woman who stole something very dear to me,
‘I'm always watching you. And thinking about you drives me to distraction.

‘One day I'll snatch you from the arms of the Goddess, and that's a promise.<page>‘Emotionally yours,
The man to whom you've caused so much pain.’
<se_high>*: ...How can he hate me so much that it drives him to distraction!?
<se_high>*: And why's he saying he'll kidnap me in revenge for me stealing something!?
<se_high>*: I've never stolen anything in my life!<page>*: And I don't know the man so how can I have caused him pain!? I just don't understand what I've done wrong!
<se_high>*: I'm sorry. This is all topsy-turvy. You probably came to the church for advice FROM me, not to give advice TO me!
<se_high>*: I just thought it might help to get it off my chest a bit... Sorry.
<se_high>*: So Marek's home safe and sound.
<se_high>*: Now I can relax and fall ill again without having to worry.
<se_high>*: I wish he wouldn't just go off like that, though! He's supposed to be the town doctor, after all!
<se_low>Mayor: Our ancestors used to live in the southern mountains where they were charged with the task of protecting some ancient ruins.
<se_low>Mayor: But life all the way out there became too difficult for them, so they moved down to the plains and that's how Orkutsk came about.
<se_low>Mayor: Nobody knows anything about the old ruins any more.
<se_low>*: Ah, so Marek goes on those trips outside town to cultivate his herbs!
<se_low>*: I had no idea he was working so hard. Who'd have thought it was such a tough job being a herb doctor!?
<se_def>*: I live out 'ere in the sticks now, but I was born in Baccarat, the big town with the world-famous casino.
<se_def>*: Rumour has it that the owner of the place, Golding, was bumped off by someone.
<se_def>*: He had two kids, as far as I remember. Wonder which one of them took over in his place...
<se_high>*: I built another snowman again today! It's even cooler than yesterday's, don't you think? Hee hee!
<se_low>*: Gaargh! That bloke's asleep here in my shop night after night!
<se_low>*: I've had enough! I'm gonna refuse to sell him any weapons from now on!
<se_def>*: It sounds like Marek managed to get hold of some nook grass. It's great stuff for making you resistant to the cold.
<se_def>*: You can get crazy prices for it out here in a place as cold as Orkutsk. People can't get enough of it!
<se_def>*: Next time I meet him, I'll see if he won't let me have some to sell in my shop.
<se_def>*: Hic! I got carried away and had a bit too much to drink! I'll have a terrible overhang...er, hangover tomorrow.
<se_def>*: Still, I can always just go to Marek for some sober-up cocktail. That'll sort me out in no time! Hic!
<se_low>*: Come to think of it, I've never actually asked Marek what this nook grass is supposed to do.
<se_low>*: Do you know what you're meant to do with it?
<se_low>*: Well, well... So you make a tea out of it that makes you resistant to the cold, eh?
<se_low>*: What a marvellous thing! Now all the drunkards here won't be able to use the cold as an excuse any more!
<se_low>*: No idea, eh? Well, it is an unusual herb, so I don't think many people know about it.
<se_low>*: ...Apchkhi!
<se_low>*: I feel all faint. And I'm so c-c-cold! I'm dying, DYING!
<se_low>*: Please, Dr. Marek. Hurry...
<se_def>*: Wasn't there a monster-looking creature with you before?
<se_def>*: No, of course there wasn't! I must've been seeing things. Bit overtired, I suppose.
<se_def>*: I've been working all hours lately. Maybe I should get Marek to make me an energy booster.
<se_def>Marek: Add medicinal herbs and a dash of moonwort bulb to nook grass tea, then stir until it boils...
<se_def>Marek: Oh! Hello again! Forgive me but, as you can see, I am a little busy at the moment.
<se_def>Marek: I will come after you as soon as I can. Will you go on ahead to my mother's house?
<se_def>Marek: I hope that there will be no problem, but... Please go and see she is all right.
<se_def>Marek: Of course I am worried about my mother, but first I have to treat my patient.
<se_def>Marek: Sorry I cannot go with you, but I will follow as soon as I can. Please go on ahead without me.
<se_def>*: Oh, it's you!
<se_def>*: Marek went after you. Did you manage to meet up?
<se_def>*: That's good. So where is he now?
<se_def>*: ...Oh! He's gone to visit someone's grave?<page>*: Is it the anniversary of someone's death then? That explains why he was in such a hurry to get away.
<se_def>*: Oh-yo-yoy! So he's gone missing again!? Sometimes I think that man causes more headaches than he cures!
<se_low>*: Am I lost again? No, no! I'm just enjoying a nice walk.
<se_low>*: I thought that a bit of a walk every day might help to reduce the size of my beer belly.
<se_def>*: Oy-yoy! Why do you look so down in the dumps?
<se_def>*: Dog run away, has it? Yeah, it always hurts when a pet doesn't take to you.
<se_def>*: Just give it a nice, juicy bit of meat! He'll be your friend for life after that.
<se_def>*: There's a really important man called the Lord High Priest living on an island to the east of here.
<se_def>*: He lives at the top of a high mountain and hardly ever comes out in public.
<se_def>*: Not that we'd ever see him all the way out here in the sticks, mind, so it doesn't much matter to us.
<se_def>*: What was that!? You've found some monuments with things written about the Godbird Empyrea!?
<se_def>*: ...Ha ha hah! Very funny! You can't get me with that one! I've realised now that no one here knows anything about her.
<se_def>*: I was a fool to believe the rumours in the first place.
<se_def>*: Can you believe what's happened!? I gave my love letter to the nun I like, and do you know what she said to it!? ‘Sorry’!
<se_def>*: I did just what the Goddess said and I confessed my feelings, but I didn't expect to get that kind of response!
<se_def>*: What do you suppose it is that's so wrong with me anyway? Huh! Stupid Goddess!
<se_def>*: ...Gurgh, don't wake me up! I'm trying to get some sleep now so that I can stay awake tonight.
<se_def>*: Tonight's the night! I'm gonna get my hands on a nice black market weapon if it's the last thing I do!
<se_def>*: I'm going back to sleep now then. Goodnight!
<se_def>*: Zzzz...phantom weapon...sword of legend...zzzz...
<se_low>*: Can you believe that man!? The nerve of him, sleeping in my shop like that! He's stopping me from doing business!
<se_high>*: Even though I have no idea what I did wrong, I must have hurt that man very badly for him to write such a threatening letter.
<se_high>*: So I went over to him and apologised profusely for whatever it was I'd done.
<se_high>*: And, thankfully, he said it was all right and that I was forgiven.
<se_high>*: So you see, if people communicate with each other directly, they can come to a common understanding.<page>*: I feel like I've really learnt something from this.
<se_high>*: Really!? Marek's left town again? Oh no!
<se_high>*: Now I'm going to be worried about falling ill again!
<se_high>*: I wish he wouldn't just go off like that! He's supposed to be the town doctor, after all!
<se_high>*: Those wolves that everyone was always talking about before seem to have gone now.
<se_high>*: Do you think a brave hero came along and got rid of them for us!?
<se_high>*: What!? You fought them off!?
<se_high>*: Wow! That's amazing! ...Although, it's not very cool to go around boasting about it.
<se_high>*: No, I suppose that kind of thing only happens in fairy tales. Ah, the real world's so boring sometimes.
<se_def>*: I heard that there's a village somewhere in the world that's full of legends about the Lord of Darkness, Rhapthorne.
<se_def>*: It must be a very remote place for its people to still be talking about something as loathsome as him.
<se_low>*: Marek told me to stay here and rest until he came back.
<se_low>*: But my cold's gone now, so how much longer do I have to lie here doing nothing!?
<se_high>*: I make snowmen every single day... If I don't think of another game soon, people will start to think I'm a one-trick husky!
<se_low>*: Hahh...Hahh... My beer belly doesn't seem to have got any smaller yet, but I'd swear my love handles are a bit less of a handful!
<se_low>*: Exercise isn't so bad if you've got a goal in mind!

<se_def>*: A man broken-hearted, feeling so hollow, ♪
And another despairing of his tomorrow, ♪
Together they drink to drown their sorrow. ♫
<se_def>*: What do you think of my new song? The lyrics are heart-rending, aren't they?
<se_def>*: Have you heard the song that poet over there's written?
<se_def>*: It's a masterpiece. The lyrics are so...so heart-rending!
<se_def>*: I've finally managed to stay awake so I can come to the weapon shop when it's open, but the owner won't sell anything to me!
<se_def>*: Maybe you need some kind of special arrangement before they'll let you buy black market goods.
<se_def>*: Rotten luck, though! I came all this way and it looks like I'll leave empty-handed.
<se_low>*: I decided I wasn't going to sell any weapons to that bloke over there.
<se_low>*: It's payback time for all those nights he got in my way by snoozing in my shop!
<se_high>*: Children are always coming down with something or other, and my husband's getting on a bit now as well...
<se_high>*: The more I think about it, the more panicky I get!
<se_high>*: I do wish Marek wouldn't just go off like that! He's supposed to be the town doctor, after all!
<se_low>*: Marek's medicine really does the trick!
<se_low>*: It's quite bitter to drink, but it puts any cold in check mate before you know it!
<se_def>*: Welcome to Orkutsk! ...Oh, it's you again! Marek's back now, if it's him you're looking for.
<se_def>*: He brought a big dog back with him as well.
<se_def>*: He seemed to be quite attached to it. I wonder where he picked it up from!?
<se_high>*: Marek's back again. But he's been so unreliable lately, going off all the time.
<se_high>*: Maybe I should start studying herbs myself...
<se_high>*: Then I'd be able to make my own medicine if I fell ill. Hmm, that's not a bad idea!
<se_def>Marek: Have you come to tell me you defeated the evil black dog that killed my mother?
<se_def>Marek: ...This is a shame. But I am sure that you will find it soon and avenge my mother's death.
<se_def>Marek: ...This is true!? You have really defeated the evil dog?
<se_def>Marek: ...Thank you. I am indebted to you once again for your efforts.
<se_def>Marek: Ah, yes! There is something I want to give you. It can in no way repay you for all you have done, but it is a small token of my thanks.
<se_def>Marek: It is not easy to prepare, but I am sure you will find some use for it.
<Cap><leader> receives four bunches of nook grass and puts them in the bag.
<se_def>Marek: I still try to go back to the ruins as often as I can and tend to my mother's herb garden.
<se_def>Marek: The next time I go, I will be sure to visit her grave and tell her this wonderful news. Thank you so much. Spasibo.
<se_low>Boris: Gav gav!
<se_def>*: Oh, Marek! You are back! It is so good to see you! We were getting a little worried, you know.
<se_def>Marek: And worry you might! Would you believe, I was attacked by a group of wolves! And these people here came to my rescue.
<se_def>*: What terrible misfortune! But fortunate, of course, that you are now back safe and sound.
<se_def>*: My humble shop depends on you and your herbs, just as the rest of the town does.
<se_def>*: It sounds like Marek managed to get hold of some nook grass. It's great stuff for making you resistant to the cold.
<se_def>*: You can get crazy prices for it out here in a place as cold as Orkutsk. People can't get enough of it!
<se_def>*: Next time I meet him, I'll see if he won't let me have some to sell in my shop.
<se_def>*: Ah, you're friends of Marek, aren't you?
<se_def>*: It must have been quite a journey for you to come all the way out here in these troubled times.
<se_low>*: This is big, really big! Have you ever seen the whole sky turn red!?
<se_low>*: Well, you wouldn't have been the only one. Anyone who was lookin' up at it that day would've seen it!
<se_low>*: I s'pose it was a bit of a stupid question then, really.
<se_low>*: I bet you haven't! Nobody has! But it actually happened the other day!
<se_low>*: I can hardly sit still! It's all so...exciting!
<se_low>*: I don't care if the sky's blue, red or green with purple spots! It won't stop me having my daily walk.
<se_low>*: One of the first rules of dieting is that you have to persevere, even if it's hard work. So that's what I'm doing!
<se_low>*: Hahh...hahh...hahh!
<se_low>*: Right! I'm going to walk until the sun goes down today!
<se_def>*: Oy-yoy! Why do you look so down in the dumps?
<se_def>*: Are you worried about the sky turning red as well?
<se_def>*: I wouldn't let it bother you. I mean, there's nothing we can do about what colour it is. So there's just no sense in losin' sleep over it.
<se_def>*: I asked Marek to give me some nook grass to sell at my shop, but he said no!
<se_def>*: Seems he's still having problems growing enough of it, so we can't put it on sale yet.
<se_def>*: It's a real shame. That stuff's like gold dust! I'd make an absolute fortune if I could start trading in it!
<se_high>*: The world's in crisis, but all my husband can think about is business.
<se_high>*: I can't figure out if he's heartless or just clueless...!
<se_def>*: Rumour has it that the sky turned red just as the new Lord High Priest was being sworn in.
<se_def>*: There are quite a few nasty rumours going around about that Marcello character...
<se_def>*: Maybe the sky turned red because the Goddess was angry at him becoming Lord High Priest.
<se_def>*: Hic! I got carried away and had a bit too much to drink!
<se_def>*: I think I've really gone too far this time. The sky looked like it had gone red!
<se_def>*: Not that it'll stop me from having a few more, mind... I wonder how much I'd have to drink to make it turn green?
<se_high>*: What!? The sky turned red!?
<se_high>*: Ha hah! How can you say something like that with a straight face!? Bit of a joker, aren't you!?
<se_high>*: I may be a bit tipsy, but you still can't make a fool of me!
<se_high>*: Actually, I haven't seen the sky for a long time now...
<se_low>*: The people in this pub are all a complete waste of space!
<se_low>*: Look at them! What a bunch of misfits! I wouldn't come here too often if I were you, otherwise you'll end up just like them!
<se_def>*: I couldn't care less about the Godbird Empyrea any more.
<se_def>*: I'm happy enough singing and drinking away my days here instead.
<se_def>*: All this stuff about a red sky and a giant shadow is no concern of mine!
<se_def>*: If only I could get my hands on one of those black market super weapons, I could set off and find out what made the sky turn red.
<se_def>*: But the owner of this place flatly refuses to sell me one.
<se_def>*: Ohh! How can I get him to trust me!?
<se_low>*: Will that man EVER give up!?
<se_low>*: I've told him time and time again that I don't have any black market weapons, but he won't believe me!
<se_high>*: We've had an awful lot of people coming to the church for guidance since the sky turned red. You can hardly blame them.
<se_high>*: I have ultimate faith in the Goddess, but even I had some concerns when I saw that!
<se_high>*: You're those friends of Marek, aren't you?
<se_high>*: Did you come here to see if he's okay after what happened with the sky turning red?
<se_high>*: It must be nice to have friends who care about you. Lucky Marek.
<se_low>Mayor: We're stuck out here in the mountains, so we're always a bit behind when it comes to hearing world news.
<se_low>Mayor: Not this time, though. I'd been doing a bit of research into things myself, you see.
<se_low>Mayor: So I know all about this terrible Lord of Darkness character. I just can't bring myself to tell everyone else about him...
<se_low>Mayor: Make sure you keep quiet about it as well, okay? I don't want to cause a panic.
<se_high>*: The master's been acting ever so strange lately. He creeps out of the house at night, you know...
<se_high>*: He must have another woman! But who in their right mind would fancy him!?
<se_low>*: Have you come to see Marek? I'm afraid he's not here.
<se_low>*: He's probably gone to his herb garden. And no doubt that big dog's gone along with him too. They're inseparable, those two.
<se_low>*: Even when the world's in crisis, he can't take any time off from tending to his herbs. What a job!
<se_def>*: The Mayor's asked me to do a bit of research into what's goin' on in the world. It doesn't look good.
<se_def>*: All the old books talk about is despair and destruction. I wonder what's going to happen to us all.
<se_high>*: The sky went red like it was on fire the other day. It looked really pretty!
<se_high>*: I don't know why it went like that, but it was cool! I hope it happens again soon!
<se_high>*: Don't talk to me now! I'm busy! I'm looking for the big shadow that flies through the sky.
<se_high>*: People say that, if you find it, you'll have good luck!
<se_low>*: Hahh... I'd say my beer belly's all but disappeared now!
<se_low>*: Exercise isn't so bad if you've got a goal in mind!
<se_def>*: I asked Marek to give me some nook grass to sell at my shop, but he said no!
<se_def>*: Seems he's still having problems growing enough of it, so we can't put it on sale yet.
<se_def>*: It's a real shame. That stuff's like gold dust! I'd make an absolute fortune if I could start trading in it!
<se_high>*: Zzzz...red sky...so cool...zzzz...
<se_high>*: I know that my husband's keeping a secret. He looks like he's got the weight of the world on his shoulders.
<se_high>*: I'm sure it's something to do with the sky turning red.
<se_high>*: I'm his wife, so I can guess that much without him having to tell me.
<se_high>*: The master goes out through the back door there every night.
<se_high>*: He must realise I can see him going! Whatever is he playing at!?
<se_high>*: I can't very well tell the mistress what's going on. I'm just a lowly maid, so I have to bite my tongue and just let him carry on.
<se_low>Mayor: I asked my helper here to find out what caused the sky to turn red, and what it might mean for the future.
<se_low>Mayor: But the more he finds out, the more uneasy I feel.
<se_low>Mayor: I really can't face telling everyone about this...
<se_def>*: So the Holy Isle of Neos was destroyed by Rhapthorne's floating castle?
<se_def>*: ...Waargh! You took me by surprise!
<se_def>*: The Mayor asked me not to tell anyone about the Lord of Darkness being resurrected.
<se_def>*: Don't you go tellin' anyone about it either, okay?
<se_def>*: Don't go tellin' people about the Lord of Darkness being resurrected.
<se_def>*: They'll only get in a panic about it.
